text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hussein to meet Egypt's President Mubarak in Red Sea port of Aqaba on Saturday.
- Cabinet may approve on Saturday bonuses for professionals working in civil service.
- Ministerial committee to study cases of owners of artesian wells who are breaching law by illegal pumping.
- Jordanian contacts Food and Agriculture Organisation to study possible compensation schemes for farming losses in Jordan Valley after spell of freezing weather.
- National committee to defend Jordanian soldier who shot Israeli schoolgirls agrees to expand defence counsel.
- King meets governor of Michigan and delegation visiting to explore investment opportunities.
- Prime Minister Majali urges development of tourism in Petra.
